titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid of the UW-Milwaukee Department of Theatre Records, 1911-2015

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department
publicationstmt.date: Copyright © 2007 University of Wisconsin Board of Regents

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Christel Maass

change.item: Ashlie Biddle removed records from the Dept of Theatre in February 2017 and placed them in other locations due to the unrelated nature of the contents to the Dept of Theatre records. A box of materials, mostly covering Fine Arts programs, sponsorships, and events, was transferred to the Peck School of Fine Arts, Office of the Dean Records (UWM AC 81). A folder was integrated into the Student Union Collection (UWM AC 124) because the show was performed in the Student Union by an outside theater troupe. Several folders containing records of the Dept of Dance as well as a box of dance posters was moved to the Dept of Dance Records (UWM AC 30).

Brad Houston updated the finding aid to reflect the addition of digital videos and images from accession 2015-009. Changes were made to extent, physdesc, processinfo, and the contents list (Series 2).

Ashlie Biddle processed the physical materials of accessions 2015-009 and 2015-033 and added them to the collection. Because the Department of Theatre and Dance split into two separate departments in 2003 and because the new materials are from the Theatre Department alone, the title of the collection was changed to the Department of Theatre Records. The bioghist was also changed to demonstrate the different names the department went through over the years. The content list was altered in the finding aid, reducing the series to two: Administrative files and Production files. The extent, abstract, and scope were updated to reflect the addition of processed materials.
Ashlie Biddle deaccessioned boxes 3-5 and merged relative documents from these boxes with the new accessions.
Dannette Lank, a student intern, made preliminary finding aid updates, under the supervision of Christel Maass, adding information about newly processed accession 2015-009.
Christel Maass updated the finding aid, adding information about new, unprocessed accession 2015-009.
Brad Houston added some material from the dribble file. Changes were made to processinfo and the contents list (box 7).

Bob Jaeger updated the finding aid following separation of the safety film negatives. The Programs and Posters series were added and the Photographs series was re-organized by date of performance. Updates included: physdesc, processinfo, arrangement, bioghist, and dsc.
Michael Doylen updated this finding to include links to individual digital objects.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. Department of Theatre

extref.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department

did.abstract: This collection contains UWM Theatre Department records consisting of alumni information, correspondence, performance planning, photographs, and programs from decades of plays and musicals performed by theater companies within the School of Fine Arts, including the Professional Theater Training Program and the University Players. Correspondence is largely between the chairs of the departments and faculty members regarding performance planning, budgeting, curriculum, and departmental activities. The correspondence from various countries details information on the several international programs the UWM theatre department participated in, including the International Theatre Festival and the World Theatre Training Institute. Faculty meeting minutes document curriculum changes, budgeting, and performance planning. Files include information on the foundation of the Theater Company (a company within the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee) and items regarding the Milwaukee Repertory Theater. Also included are production files, which contain performance budgets, set designs, programs, promotional materials, and performance reviews, as well as photographs, negatives, and slides. Items predating 1964 (the year of the department's creation) are programs and photographs of performances by players of University Theater, a drama club of UWM, and the Dramatic Club of the State Normal School.

bioghist.p: Activity in the theater arts at UWM dates to 1911, when plays and musicals were given by the Dramatic Club and the senior class of the State Normal School. Prior to 1964, theater arts classes were taken through the Department of Speech. The Department of Theatre Arts officially began in the spring semester of 1964, two years after the formation of the School of Fine Arts. In 1982, the Department of Dance and the Department of Theatre Arts merged into one department. In 2003, the Department of Theatre and Dance split and became two separate departments once again.

bioghist.head: Department of Theatre and Dance Chairs

scopecontent.p: Department of Theatre Administrative Files contain records related to the department's management and administration. Included are correspondence, planning documents, faculty meeting minutes, alumni information, honorary society records, and department publicity. The Administrative Files also document events produced and promoted by the Theatre Department such as Summer in the Park, the International Theatre Festival, and production tours and trips.

Production files, organized by date, contain records of specific plays, musicals, or other performances. These files may contain programs, production notes, budgets, set and other production designs, posters, published reviews and play publicity. Some productions have corresponding blueprints. Production files also include performance photographs maintained in separate photograph files that are organized by date. Actor's headshots and program-related photographs are organized by subject and are maintained as part of the Administrative Files.

arrangement.p: The records are arranged into the following series:

otherfindaid.p: An inventory for all of the productions is available electronically in the Archives' case file.

altformavail.p:

UWM Photo Collection .

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material in the UWM Libraries

archref.unittitle: UW-Milwaukee School of Fine Arts Records

separatedmaterial.head: Deaccession Information
separatedmaterial.p: A Pabst Brewing Company poster was separated from accession 2015-009 and placed in the Pabst Brewing Company Records collection (UWM Mss 161) in an oversize folder.

Materials were separated from accessions 2015-009 and 2015-033 and placed in the UWM Peck School of Arts, Office of the Dean Records(UWM AC 81) as Box 28. A folder of records containing information on a performance by Theatre Sans Fil was transferred to Box 9 in the Student Union Collection (UWM AC 124). Several folders and a box of dance posters were transferred to the Dept of Dance Records (UWM AC 30).

accessrestrict.p: Box 6 contains confidential student information that is restricted under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act of 1974 (FERPA).
There are no access restrictions on the rest of the collection, which is open to all members of the public in accordance with state law.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of libel, privacy, and copyright which may be involved in the use of this collection (Wisconsin Statutes 19.21-19.39).

phystech.p: As of October 10, 2016, all electronic files were accessible on an Intel Core i5-4570 CPU (3.20 GHz, 4 GB RAM) running Windows 7 Enterprise with service pack 1. VLC media player was used to access the files.
The collection contains files in the following formats:

acqinfo.p: An unknown individual transferred the collection to the Archives prior to 1989. The Estate of Gene Schuttey donated accession 2007-021 in September 2007. The department transferred additional materials in November 2015 (accession 2015-009) and February 2016 (accession 2015-033).

processinfo.p: Bill Jackson processed the collection at the Archives in July 1994. Rachel Arndt processed accession 2007-021 in October 2007.
In September 2011, Bob Jaeger reprocessed the collection, arranging it into three series and placing the safety film negatives into box 8.

Brad Houston added some additional material in November 2012. Dannette Lank, a student intern under the supervision of Christel Maass, processed a portion of accession 2015-009 in March 2016. Ashlie Biddle finished processing accessions 2015-009 and 2015-033 during the Summer of 2016. The entire collection was also reprocessed during this time and rearranged into two series. In October 2016, Brad Houston added the digital portions of 2015-009 to the main collection.

processinfo.head: Preservation Information
processinfo.p: During processing, videos received on DVD and CD-R were ripped to the Archives server,. then converted to MP4 files to serve as preservation masters. Handbrake 0.10.5.0 was used to convert the original Video Object files.
Digital images received as part of accession 2015-009 were converted to TIFF format during processing to serve as preservation masters. XnView MP 0.82 was used to convert the files.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged alphabetically by subject.

physdesc.extent: The production photographs consist of a mix of 8x10, 5x7, 4x6, and 3x5 sizes. Unless otherwise stated, all of the negatives are 35 mm safety film.

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged chronologically by production season and thereafter alphabetically by production title. Brochures and fliers are in boxes 1-11, photographs in boxes 12-18, slides in box 19, negatives in boxes 20-22, posters in box 23, and blueprints in oversize folders 1-5.
